arts.ttl: Tim Walter lays down challenge to in-form Hull City after Cardiff City rout
arts.sum: The victory was particularly special given it came as the club celebrated its 120th birthday, though it looked like the Bluebirds would be the stereotypical party poopers when they took an 18th-minute lead through Callum Robinson, a goal Walter felt should have been chalked off through offside. They showed the will to win in an impressive way, so I'm happy about our mentality and how they stuck together, how they celebrated together with the fans, especially our goals which is good."

arts.ttl: Omer Riza doubles down on desire to be Cardiff City boss despite damaging Hull City defeat
arts.sum: The interim Bluebirds boss spoke after his first game in charge saw Cardiff get hammered 4-1 up at Hull City

arts.ttl: Cardiff City suffer sixth defeat in seven games as another dire display sees them battered at Hull City
arts.sum: The Bluebirds slumped to a 4-1 defeat in Omer Riza's first game as interim manager as they remain bottom of the table

arts.ttl: Mohamed Belloumi masterclass inspires Hull City to big birthday victory over Cardiff City
arts.sum: As they did a week ago at Stoke City, the Tigers found themselves a goal down but roared back with Belloumi's brilliant brace and one in the second half from Oscar Zambrano, to earn Tim Walter back-to-back wins and a first home success as City boss on a day the club celebrated its 120th birthday. After a couple of nervy moments at the start of the second half, City went 3-1 up after a spell of pressure saw Zambrano's effort take a rather helpful deflection to wrongfoot Alnwick and divert into the far corner.

arts.ttl: Hull City player ratings as Belloumi and Bedia impress in Cardiff City romp
arts.sum: Oscar Zambrano made it 3-1 early in the second half as the Tigers took the game beyond the Bluebirds, and Chris Bedia scored his first from the penalty spot in the final minute. A Mohamed Belloumi brace earned Hull City their first home win under Tim Walter as they came from a goal down to thump bottom side Cardiff City 4-1 at the MKM Stadium, on a day the club celebrated its 120th birthday.

Cardiff City : Alnwick, Ng, Fish (Rinomhota 39'), Chambers, Collins (Tanner 61'), Robertson, Ralls, El Ghazi (Kanga 73'), O'Dowda (Turnbull 73'), Colwill, Robinson (Willock 61'). Subs Not Used : Rushworth, Giles, Burns, Burstow.

arts.ttl: Bachir Belloumi scores twice as Hull rout managerless Cardiff
arts.sum: The Bluebirds opened the scoring through Callum Robinson after 18 minutes but fell apart thereafter.

arts.ttl: Hull City star makes frank MKM Stadium admission as Tigers aim to celebrate 120th birthday in style
arts.sum: "It's obviously really good to get the first win of the season, and hopefully that can kind of kick start something for us starting on Saturday against Cardiff. Hull City must grasp their chance to really kick start their season when they host Cardiff City on Saturday afternoon, according to defender Sean McLoughlin.

arts.ttl: Millar starts: Hull City team news and predicted XI to face Cardiff City
arts.sum: Hull City are back in Championship action this weekend with a home clash against Cardiff City. Hull Cityâ€¦ The post Millar starts: Hull City team news and predicted XI to face Cardiff City appeared first on The72 - Football League News.

arts.ttl: Hull City duo get Tim Walter's seal of approval after 'really hard' period
arts.sum: "It's not really easy, because he (Millar) has a lot of long travelling all the time and so, too, Kasey," Walter said when asked to assess the impact of the Canadian. Both endured lots of travelling in the last international break, and Walter says the impact shouldn't be underestimated.
